definition: a quick run, add an enlivening or altering element to
details:
noun
- a quick run
= synonyms: sprint
- the act of moving with great haste
= example: the act of moving with great haste
= synonyms: bolt
- distinctive and stylish elegance
= example: distinctive and stylish elegance
= synonyms: style, panache, elan, flair
- the longer of the two telegraphic signals used in Morse code
= synonyms: dah
- a punctuation mark (-) used between parts of a compound word or between the syllables of a word when the word is divided at the end of a line of text
= synonyms: hyphen
- a footrace run at top speed
= example: a footrace run at top speed
verb
- add an enlivening or altering element to
= example: add an enlivening or altering element to
- break into pieces, as by striking or knocking over
= synonyms: smash
- hurl or thrust violently
= example: hurl or thrust violently
= synonyms: crash
- cause to lose courage
= example: cause to lose courage
= synonyms: pall, scare, daunt, scare off, frighten off, scare away, frighten away
- run or move very quickly or hastily
= example: run or move very quickly or hastily
= synonyms: shoot
- destroy or break
= example: destroy or break
